entry.para: The watermark module provides a way to render an vectorbased overlay onto your image. Watermarks are standard SVG documents and can be designed using Inkscape, the SVG precessor of Darktable does also substitute strings within the SVG document which gives the oppurtunity to include image dependent information in the watermark such as aperture, exposure time and other meta-data.

Userdesigned watermarks are placed into the directory ~/.config/darktable/watermarks, once in place use the reload button at the left of the choice of watermark to update the list of available watermarks to use.

sect4.title: marker
sect4.para: Choose the watermark of interest, use the reload button next to the combobox to update list with newly added watermarks. .

sect4.title: opacity
sect4.para: Sets the opacity of the render of watermark.

sect4.title: alignment
sect4.para: Use this controls to align the watermark to any edge or center of the image.

sect4.title: x offset
sect4.para: Pixelindependent offset realtive to the choice of alignment on x-axis.

sect4.title: y offset
sect4.para: Pixelindependent offset relative to the choice of alignment on y-axis.
